Eligibility: Adult women > 18 years of age who develop neuropathic pain in the area of breast scars and/or ipsilateral arm following breast cancer surgery
There is no recurrent disease in the painful area
Is able to read, write and understand English
There is another type of pain that is more severe than neuropathic pain.
Using an opioid analgesic of more than 60 mg codein/day
Is actively trying to get pregnant
To a medical contraindication to the use of lidocaine
He's taking a coanalgesic for neuropathic pain.
Results: Change in pain intensity on a scale of 11 basis points at 12 weeks

The patients noted their pain intensity in the breast and/or ipsilateral arm using a rating scale 0 to 10, ranging from the absence of pain (0) to the worst pain imaginable (10). The change in pain intensity was calculated from two points of time such as the subsequent point of time (12 weeks) minus the previous point of time (Baseline).
